revised_title: Pigment Epithelial Sheath and Phagocytosis of Extrafoveal Cones in Human Retina
tldr: The study examines the relationship between human extrafoveal cone outer segments and pigment epithelial apical processes. It describes how these processes engulf and digest packets of terminal disks, which are shed by the cones. This process is observed in three human retinas with varying ages, providing evidence of its normalcy.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
